name: Pixorial
overview:
Pixorial is a cloud-based consumer platform for storing, sharing and creating video in full quality. Pixorial’s innovative, integrated video platform eliminates the barriers between consumers and their videos, enabling them to easily enjoy or create personal video anywhere, regardless of source. Put simply, Pixorial’s aim is to make all video memories accessible, relevant, and shareable to anyone, anywhere.

Regardless of whether video was captured on a mobile phone, a web camera, film, digital or old VHS tapes, Pixorial enables consumers to unlock their videos and enjoy them on the go, online or on the big screen.

Users can experience a whole new level of storytelling by collecting and sharing original videos with Pixorial. Pixorial’s unique “Crowd” feature allows users to discover and share the original, editable, high-quality video footage that is most meaningful to them.

Pixorial’s web-based editing tools make it simple to trim, add titles, music and transitions to video creations, with no software installation required.

Pixorial was selected as a Google Drive launch partner, offering seamless integration with Google’s cloud service. Pixorial is also available on iOS and Android phones and tablets, and offers a Facebook app that allows users to share and edit videos.

Pixorial allows users to share videos without worrying about privacy or tracking. Users can broadcast videos to the social sharing platforms of their choice: Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, Vimeo, Blogger, and more. They can also create and send a customized Videocard or DVD.

Pixorial is a privately held company based in Englewood, CO, founded by Netscape veteran Andrés Espiñeira and run by seasoned technology professionals from companies such as Microsoft, Canon and Disney.
